ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: All activities of the Nyas have a Focus exclusively of the tribal Developments. I. Leading to the establishment of the ITITI two major event were organized : (a) Seminar on IT Opportunities In Uttarakhand and Reaching The Unreachable on May 20,2001 at Dehradun (b) Nation Discussion on educational curriculum and Methodology for the Tribal Students on 8th July 2001 at New Delhi. II. A tribal cultural Centre and Auditorium is being set up at the ITITIs campus.The centre is to be a museum showcasing the rich cultural heritage of the tribes from North-East. The centre will also have a database on Indian Tribes. Year round Programmes by tribes, movies on their life and aspirations, books publishing and dissemination of information about them are some of the Centre. III Other activities include tree planting animal husbandry and medicinal plant farming. IV. Currently 165 tribal student from 12 states are pursuing their studies at the institute.

ngoList.title: The Friends Of The Doon Society
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: For the last 34 years FODS has been involved in various environmental initiatives, including at the â€˜grass roots levelâ€™, such as the resettlement of Gujjars from the erstwhile Rajaji National Park to the Pathri resettlement colony developed for this purpose by the State Govt. 540 Gujjar families were resettled, taught stall fed dairy and arming. growing fodder crops. FODS also ran a school with 350 Gujjar children. In this project FODS was supported by the US Fish and Wildlife Service, and ASHA for Education Funds, USA. The Society is engaged in conservation of wildlife mainly elephants of The Rajaji National Park (RNP), now the Rajaji Tiger Reserve (RTR), and was also been involved in a survey on tiger population in Rajaji. Since 2001, every year, during monsoon, the society organises Tree Plantation Programmes in and around Dehradun., and over the years several thousand trees have been successfully planted. The Society also has a very popular programme for Nature and Environment awareness for children from needy families studying in Govt schools. From the last 10 years the society is working to make Village Rasulpur and neighbouring villages located in the impoverished southern boundary of the RTR into model villages. We are funded for this work by of GEF UNDP Small Grants Programme, Sir Ratan Tata and other Tata Trusts, COMDEKS initiative of the Govt of Japan, formerly Elephant Family Multi Fund, U.K and the Village Community. Positive results motivated the society and its sponsors to replicate the activities in other nearby villagers. We have also worked with WWF. FODS has received a citation from the then government of Uttar Pradesh, for its exemplary work in conservation of nature and wildlife, and has been commended by UNDP for creating model villages.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: To achieve objectives of imparting Skill Based Technical Training to the unemployed youth of Uttarakhand, Unique Technical Training & Educational Society had signed an M.O.U. with Indian Institute of Entrepreneurship, an organization of Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises, Govt. of India, Regional Office, Dehradun, Head Office Guwahati (Assam) and became partner institute to conduct Skill Based Technical Training Programmes in various locations of Uttarakhand. Entrepreneur Skill Development Programmes are sponsored by Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises, Govt. of India and jointly monitored by Indian Institute of Entrepreneurship and District Industries Center of the respective districts. These programmes are conducted by Unique Technical Training & Educational Society with its best infrastructure facility, competent faculties and other supportive staff. To impart skill based technical training to the needy people Unique Technical Training and Educational Society has opened three centers â€“ two in Dehradun (One in District Head Quarter and One in Rural Area â€“ Doiwala) and one in Purola Uttarkashi where training to the youth is being imparted especially in the field of Information Technology (Computer Hardware & Networking, Computer Accounting with Tally, Desk Top Publishing, IT Tools and Application, Web Designing, Data Entry Operator etc.) as Information Technology is need of the hour and there is lots avenues available in this field.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: USNPSS has contributed towards development of Uttarakhand as follows: 1. Reforming government policy on education in Uttarakhand â€¢ Development and mainstreaming of an environmental education course in the school curriculum of Uttarakhand. Currently, students in classes 6 to 8 in all government schools study workbooks developed by USNPSS. In cooperation with the state government, especially the SCERT and DIETs, the books have been modified many times; the most recent modification was in 2015. â€¢ Running 350 balwadis in the hills and developing a programme for Early Childhood Care and Education (ECCE) which was used by the state government in the preschool programme. The resource team of master-trainers for ECCE in the education department of Uttarakhand is trained by USNPSS. 2. Nodal Agency for the Ministry of Human Resource Development, GOI from 1987 to 2006 â€¢ Identifying and nurturing more than 281 small NGOs, CBOs and individuals working in Kumaon and Garhwal. Many have built their own institutional capacity to execute programmes in villages. â€¢ Developed an Innovative approach to connect schools with rural communities. 3. Regional Resource Agency (RRA) of the Ministry of Environment and Forests, GOI from 1993 to 2006 â€¢ Supported environmental awareness programmes and diverse activities in schools, villages and cities of Uttarakhand. This involved identifying and evaluating the organisations, writing reports, keeping accounts and collaboration with various government and non-government institutes 4. Setting up a womenâ€™s federation, Uttarakhand Mahila Parishad â€¢ The largest network of rural womenâ€™s groups in the state, UMP, has a membership of about 16,000 women from about 490 villages in the hills of Kumaon and Garhwal. 5. Developing educational materials for use in villages â€¢ Educational aids and innovative methods of learning developed by USNPSS for children, adolescents, women â€¢ Developed more than 100 publications in Hindi on locally relevant issues, articles in refereed Journals, magazines and newspapers. Published an atlas of Uttarakhand in 1997. 6. Action programmes â€¢ Setting up of libraries, evening centres, computer literacy centres, life skills for adolescent girls, womenâ€™s literacy centres, village learning centres in villages. These programmes have received acclaim and recognition in various national and international journals and books. â€¢ Provision and conservation of water includes rain water harvesting, trenches (chal/khav), cheap polythene lined tanks, simple pits to collect water etc. â€¢ Regeneration, conservation, protection of forests, afforestation â€¢ Sanitation (more than 10,000 sanitation facilities installed â€¢ Installation of green houses to grow off season vegetables and preserve the local seeds â€¢ Fisheries, horticulture, apiculture, food processing, knitting etc. to generate income 7. Training of schools teachers on EE, DIETS, facilitators, supervisors, NGOs, rural women and adolescent girls 8. Research â€¢ Indian Council for Agricultural Research, ICAR, under the competitive grants section of the National Initiative on Climate Resilient Agriculture, NICRA during 2011 to 2014 â€¢ Indian Council of Social Science Research, ICSSR, on Gender issues in the Development of Ecologically Fragile Zones: A case study of village communities in Uttarakhand (gender and social ecology) (2014-16) â€¢ GIZ supported project on climate change in 2011

sourceOfFunds.purpose: In the year 2017-18 Uttaranchal sanskritik kalyan samiti was engaged in supplying of milk, purpose to do so was to provide pure milk to society and to reduce the consumption of pasteurised milk packed in plastic, which is very harmfull specially its very dangerous to children and old age people, so we decided to raise cattle and also collect milk from near by households and supply it to places where it requires, milk is daily use item,people consume it to develop immunity to stay healthy

In the year 2018-19 uttaranchal sanskritik kalyan samiti was continuing its milk supply and providing pure milk to society as we already know that today pure milk production has come across with drastic downfall. people are not raising there cattles anymore they are dependable on the pasteurised milk which is very harmfull specially for the childrens and old age people. so USKS has initiated this to provide good quality of milk to all hosehold so that the consumption of packed milk can be stop

In the year 2019-20 uttaranchal sanskritik kalyan samiti was continuing its milk supply and providing pure milk to society as we already know that today pure milk production has come across with drastic downfall. people are not raising there cattles anymore they are dependable on the pasteurised milk which is very harmfull specially for the childrens and old age people. so USKS has initiated this to provide good quality of milk to all hosehold so that the consumption of packed milk can be stop

In the year 2020-21 Uttaranchal sanskritik kalyan samiti was running dairy farm and providing pure milk in minimum price so that everybody can afford it and utilise it for their well being , purpose to do so was to provide pure milk to society and to reduce the consumption of pasteurised milk packed in plastic, which is very harmfull specially its very dangerous to children and old age people, milk is daily use item,people consume it to develop immunity to stay healthy
